issue.title: Picnic constant time tests fail
issue.body: It seems that #1116 has caused the constant time tests to fail, see https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/1822/workflows/698260d6-a9f1-4ecc-8586-e24e3368014b/jobs/15792.  @christianpaquin can you take a look?

comment.body: How can I figure out why the tests are skipped? I'd like to be able to run them before playing around with the exclusion files.

issue.title: Constant time checks for aarch64
issue.body: As per a comment by @baentsch on this [PR](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1117#pullrequestreview-793886320), do we want to add constant time checks for aarch64?

comment.body: That does seem like a good idea. We'll need to run those test suites on an ARM machine though, since it's a runtime test.

issue.title: Picnic constant time tests fail
issue.body: It seems that #1116 has caused the constant time tests to fail, see https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/1822/workflows/698260d6-a9f1-4ecc-8586-e24e3368014b/jobs/15792.  @christianpaquin can you take a look?

comment.body:
> Are you building liboqs in a subdirectory other than `build`?

Yes.

> Also check the contents of `build/include/oqs/oqsconfig.h` to make sure that `OQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME` and `OQS_DEBUG_BUILD` are really being set.

They are set.

Puzzling...

issue.title: Picnic constant time tests fail
issue.body: It seems that #1116 has caused the constant time tests to fail, see https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/1822/workflows/698260d6-a9f1-4ecc-8586-e24e3368014b/jobs/15792.  @christianpaquin can you take a look?

comment.body:
> > Are you building liboqs in a subdirectory other than `build`?
> 
> Yes.
> 
> > Also check the contents of `build/include/oqs/oqsconfig.h` to make sure that `OQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME` and `OQS_DEBUG_BUILD` are really being set.
> 
> They are set.
> 
> Puzzling...

Right, so I think the problem is building in a subdirectory other than `build`.  Try doing this build in the subdirectory `build`, or alternatively setting the environment variable `OQS_BUILD_DIR`.

issue.title: Picnic constant time tests fail
issue.body: It seems that #1116 has caused the constant time tests to fail, see https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/1822/workflows/698260d6-a9f1-4ecc-8586-e24e3368014b/jobs/15792.  @christianpaquin can you take a look?

comment.body: Alternatively, `ninja run_tests` from the build directory should include the constant time tests as well, even if the directory is named differently than `build`.

> > > 
> > > 
> > > Yes.
> 
> Sorry, I meant no! (yes, I'm using `build`; pre-coffee brain...)

:)

Are you using your own VM or a Docker image?  I was running inside an OQS Docker image:

```
docker run -dti openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64:latest /bin/bash
docker attach (whatever the output was above)
```

comment.body: I'm running in an Azure ubuntu VM. I'll try docker...

issue.title: Adding support for multiple upstream to copy_from_upstream, as well as pqclean's aarch64 kyber implementation
issue.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
There are two parts to this PR:
1) Adding support to copy_from_upstream.py to specify specific upstreams for arch-specific implementations
2) Pulling in pqclean's aarch64 optimized implementation of Kyber.

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body:
> Shouldn't there be an update in docs/algorithms/kem/kyber.yml? Also shouldn't all the docs/algorithms/kem/*.md files be regenerated?

Updating docs is the next thing on my list. Sorry I forgot to mention that I haven't updated the doc generation scripts yet. I wanted to get a PR for the copy_from_upstream script started early incase I had to change anything major.

issue.title: Constant time checks for aarch64
issue.body: As per a comment by @baentsch on this [PR](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1117#pullrequestreview-793886320), do we want to add constant time checks for aarch64?

comment.body:
> That does seem like a good idea. We'll need to run those test suites on an ARM machine though, since it's a runtime test.

Yes. FWIW/reminder: We have an `aarch64` VM at AWS that's regularly running profiling on that architecture and which might be used for this, too.

2) Pulling in pqclean's aarch64 optimized implementation of Kyber.

comment.body:
One thing I didn't think of until I pulled in sabre by mistake:

Should I add support for specifying specific commits and/or branches for arch specific upstreams?

issue.title: Picnic constant time tests fail
issue.body: It seems that #1116 has caused the constant time tests to fail, see https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/1822/workflows/698260d6-a9f1-4ecc-8586-e24e3368014b/jobs/15792.  @christianpaquin can you take a look?

comment.body:
> How can I figure out why the tests are skipped? 

Could it be [this](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/468533abea77e7a7900ee9fdd82856ed25d06c2b/tests/test_constant_time.py#L229), i.e., your `valgrind` version is insufficient/not properly installed?
